content: The challenge is that the composition window ties the from address with the smtp server. If the change matches another account, thunderbird will use the other server. The suggestions shown in thunderbird are minor, deviating only slightly from original.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi david!

Thanks for the reply.

Not sure if I understand you correctly: Are you refering to having 2 accounts configured on the same mail domain and the unintended one being used for outgoing mail? This would be something I could understand, since the same @domain.tld part makes the decision for TB somewhat random. However, this is not the case with me.

Let me describe my problem a little more detailed, should have done in the first place.

Account setup:

  • other unrelated fremailers
  • alice@mydomain1.com, uses smtp.mydomain1.com with alice credentials, collects all email for @mydomain1.com
  • bob@mydomain2.com, uses smtp.mydomain2.com with bob credentials, collects all email for @mydomain2.com
  • no other accounts with @mydomain1.com or @mydomain2.com are configured in TB

Sending email via "customize from address" as e.g. charlie@mydomain1.com (no charlie TB identity created with alice@mydomain1.com) This email then ended up being sent out via SMTP server of bob@mydomain2.com - making it hard for me to see a reason for that decision.

It is just an occasional problem, happened 2 times in 6 months now. I am not able to reproduce it so far, even using the same addresses involved again and again.
creator: sparklingstarfish

content: I am only a volunteer and cannot diagnose the issue, but must address only possibilities. The selection of SMTP server is dependent on the from address, so there is possibility of a bug somewhere. Finding it, though, would probably require explicit details on both of your accounts and the various customizations that you did. I am NOT requesting that info, just advising my opinion. My 'guess' is that you're customizing 'too much'... :)
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks, yes sure I understand. I recognized the debug logging seems to be pretty detailed. Will try to gather as much info as possible. Hopefully this will help get more insights next time it happens.
creator: sparklingstarfish

content: I understand your disappointment, and I thank you for being a donor; users such as you are the backbone of Thunderbird. However, we are just users such as yourself, neither developers or employees, but giving of our free time to assist others. If I may offer a suggestion: when posting a problem, the more information you share in post increases the likelihood of a response. For example, knowing POP or IMAP, whether thunderbird was just updated, release version of thunderbird, plus any error messages. Knowing that, a volunteer may be more apt to respond, as the volunteer may have ideas for a possible solution. If you still do not have the ability to send messages, is that because the Send button is missing, or the 'new message' button is missing? If it is the 'new message' button, click view>folders and tick 'folder pane header' to restore it. If the 'send' button is missing from compose window, let me know and I'll provide further info. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for the explanation. However, there is surely a controlling person or original programmer that carries out daily maintenance and improvements such as those recently implemented, it can't all function in a 'self-driving' manner? Where does my contribution go?
creator: john1095

content: Your contribution reinforces problems that have already been reported and are under investigation. The Thunderbird support structure is huge and most bugs are intertwined such that a problem reported on the forum here is not such that it can be quickly assessed and repaired and updated in a day or two. Thunderbird does not have daily maintenance, but code changes go through multiple levels, often taking weeks for what seems a simple change to get from coding to a release version. I assure you that a senior manager reviews activity here and summarizes within the development team regularly. Thank you for caring and for continuing to provide feedback and report problems as they occur.
creator: davidsk

content: My apologies, as I assume IMAP too often, yet you clearly stated POP. For POP, there is only one download folder, so the spam folder online is not eligible, and the junk folder would not have the feature I mentioned because that feature is not available for POP. If you want to download the online spam filter, you will need to set your online account to not flag spam.

content:
Okay, this may sound strange, but here is the real way to set fonts on Thunderbird. And I attached examples of my own setting of Calibri 14 as my default. Here goes:

  1. in Tools>settings>general, set your default font.
  2. then click the advanced button. Notice the drop-down menu at top. It probably says 'latin' or 'other writing systems' - this is IMPORTANT:
  3. select 'latin from that menu, set your desired font and font size settings, click OK,
  4. select 'otherwritingsystems' from the drop-down menu and set the IDENTICAL settings to what you did for Latin, and then click OK. In attached screenshots you will see my latin and otherwritingsystem match. Notice I also set monospace font.
  5. if you have account set to compose HTML, then set that in tools>settings>composition to variable-width and medium font. (You would only change the HTML font setting if your intent is for recipient to receive your preferred font - not my personal recommendation.)
  6. In settings>composition, set Sending Format to 'automatic' (just my preference, not required)

NOTE: if font size is still too small, try a larger number, such as 20. the numbers in thunderbird are points, not pixels.
creator: davidsk

content: The MS letter mentioned more than authentication: you need outlook.office365.com (SSSL/TLS and 993 for IMAP) as incoming server and smtp.office365.com (STARTTLS and port 587) as outgoing server and you do not need to remove and add back the account. If you are having trouble, please post screenshots of incoming and outgoing servers
creator: davidsk

content:
Removing and re-adding is certainly the easiest way. As for loosing your e-mails it depends on how it's set-up. If it's using IMAP the e-mails never leave MicroSoft's server, unless you delete them, and Thunderbird is only a tool to view them. If it's set to use POP3 then they are downloaded to your computer and the originals probably deleted. If there's uncertainty it's best to keep this method as a last resort. As an aside if your e-mails are on your computer you really should look into how to make backup copies as hard disks can fail and you'd loose the lot.

I'm on HotMail and here are the settings that work fine for me:—

Server Name: outlook.office365.com Port: 993 User Name: <my name>@hotmail.com Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2

Now click 'Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the left hand column. Double click the Outlook.com entry and enter these details:—

Server Name: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method: OAuth2 User Name: <your e-mail address>

I am assuming that you are using the current, or at least a fairly recent version of Thunderbird. Old ones don't support OAuth2.

content:
If you've already added the account to Thunderbird but it's no longer working it's probably down to changes that MicroSoft have made to the authentication method for logging in.

Press Alt-e and choose Account Settings from the drop-down menu that appears, then click Server Settings under the HotMail account and enter these details:—

  Server Name: outlook.office365.com   Port: 993   User Name: <your e-mail address>   Connection security: SSL/TLS   Authentication method: OAuth2

Now click 'Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the left hand column. Double click the Outlook.com entry and enter these details:—

  Server Name: smtp.office365.com   Port: 587   Connection security: STARTTLS   Authentication method: OAuth2   User Name: <your e-mail address>

If you haven't got the account set-up in Thunderbird click Account Actions then Add Email Account and it's pretty much automatic from there.
creator: ThePillenwerfer
